statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Gerry McNamara scored 25 points and Josh Wright had a career-high 19 as Syracuse (No. 24 ESPN/USA Today, Unranked AP) erased an 11-point deficit in the final 2:21 of regulation and beat Manhattan 87-82 in overtime on Wednesday night.
article.headline: Syracuse needs overtime to get past Manhattan
article.linkText: Syracuse needs overtime to get past Manhattan
article.story: SYRACUSE, N.Y. (AP) -- Gerry McNamara scored 25 points and Josh Wright had a career-high 19 as Syracuse (No. 24 ESPN/USA Today, Unranked AP) erased an 11-point deficit in the final 2:21 of regulation and beat Manhattan 87-82 in overtime on Wednesday night. The victory came two days after Syracuse (5-2) fell from No. 17 out of the AP Top 25, and what was shaping up as a rout at halftime turned into a nailbiter in the final minutes of regulation. Darryl Watkins had 12 points and 11 rebounds for the Orange before fouling out late in the second half, and Demetris Nichols finished with 10 points. Mike Konovelchick led Manhattan (0-3) with 21 points, all after halftime, CJ Anderson had 19 points and 13 rebounds, Jeff Xavier had 13 points, and Kenny Minor had 11. Syracuse trailed 72-61 after Arturo Dubois hit two free throws with 2:21 left, but McNamara was fouled while shooting a 3-pointer and hit all three free throws to start the comeback. McNamara followed that by draining two more 3s in a 20-second span in the final minute, and freshman Eric Devendorf forced the extra period by hitting a 3 from the right wing with 14.2 seconds left. It was his only basket of the game. The Jaspers blew a chance at victory by missing seven straight free throws in the final 1:42 and made only 1-of-8 shots in the extra period. Terrence Roberts followed a miss by McNamara to give the Orange an 83-82 lead in the final minute of overtime, and Wright and McNamara followed by converting two free throws apiece to secure the win. Wright's free throws came after he was intentionally fouled by Anderson. After a slow start, Syracuse played a near flawless first half, holding the Jaspers without a field goal for nearly eight minutes and gaining a 38-18 lead at the break. Everything changed in the second, though, after the 6-foot-11 Watkins was called for his fourth foul just over a minute into the period. The Jaspers began pounding the ball inside and used a 16-4 run to storm back. A 3-pointer by Minor from the right corner put Manhattan up 57-56 at 7:39, its first lead since early in the game, and Syracuse seemed doomed when the Jaspers kept up the pressure and went on a 15-5 spurt to gain a stunning 11-point lead. Konowelchick hit his fourth 3-pointer of the game, drained another with the shot clock set to go off, and consecutive baskets by Anderson had Manhattan up 70-61 with 2:46 left.
